Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf goal # requirement build and maintain a secure network and systems 1 2 install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data do not use vendor -supplied for system passwords and other security parameters protect cardholder data 3 4 protect stored cardholder data encrypt transmission of cardholder data across open , public networks maintain a vulnerability management program 5 6 protect all systems against malware and regularly update anti - virus software or programs develop and maintain secure systems and applications implement strong access control measures 7 8 9 restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know identify and authenticate access to system components restrict physical access to cardholder data regularly monitor and test networks 10 11 track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data regularly test security systems and processe s maintain an information security policy 12 maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel information technology general it security policy it security last update : 11 june 2020 13/15 document version : 1.5 1.10.1 network security and firewalls all systems in the pci dss scope must strictly respect the accor network security policy , in particular : • documentation ( with business justification ) and approval process for opening all network connections and flows . 1000%

wireless access points , gateways , handheld devices , networking/communications hardware , and telecommunication lines restricted no do identification methods ( such as id badges ) clearly identify maintained yes are visitors identified and given a badge or other identification that visibly distinguishes the visitors from onsite personnel yes does the visitor log contain the visitors name , the firm represented , and the onsite personnel authorizing physical access yes is the visitor log retained for at least three months yes are all media physically secured ( including but not limited to computers , removable electronic media , paper receipts , paper reports , and faxes ) yes are quarterly external vulnerability network scans performed yes is a security policy established , published Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.9 incident management 1.9.1 nature of incidents security incidents include , but are not limited to virus , worm , and trojan horse detection , unauthorized use of computer accounts and computer systems , data breaches , as well as complaints of improper use of information resources as outlined in other polic y documents such as the it usage policy . 400%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.9.2 responsibilities in the event of an incident , the person in charge of the impacted system or data is responsible for reporting it to the corporate it security team . 400%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf glossary of terms used alert following items are considered as security alerts : - it security alerts : o intrusion detection system ( ids ) or file integrity monitoring ( fim ) alert ; o unauthorized activity ( invalid login attempt , unauthorized log deletion , etc . ) 300%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf accor cyber -attack and data breach response plan version : 1.8 date of effect : 09/06/202 1 page : 4 of 29 confidential – internal use only for pci dss specifically , incident means a system or data breach such as : - printed cardholder data stolen ( merchant tickets , fax ) ; - cardholder dat a stolen using social engineering ( scam ) ; - physical attacks using skimmers or tampered payment terminal ; - server or computer intrusion inside pci dss perimeter , stolen server ; - any alert raised by a card scheme or acquiring bank ; - any alert qualified by it security as security incident ; - any incident raised by third party ( call centers , pms providers ) ; - unauthorized wireless device ( wifi , 3g/4g , etc . ) 300%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf audit team ensure s the existence of the incident procedure and its application . 300%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf these lists are intended to be a starting point : • contact information for team members and others within and outside the organization ( primary and backup contacts ) , such as law enforcement and other incident response teams ; • incident reporting mechanisms , such as phone numbers , email addresses , online forms , and secure instant messaging systems that users can use to report suspected incidents ; • issue tracking system for tracking incident inform ation , status , etc . 300%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf the application -specific procedure can be used to document the initial communication of the incident response plan , the last training date , etc . 300%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf some examples of security alerts that an employee might recognize in their day to day activities include , but are not limited to : ▪ theft , damage , or unauthorized access ( e.g. , unauthorized logins , papers missing from their desk , b roken locks , missing log files , alert from security guard , video evidence of a break -in or unscheduled/unauthorized physical entry ) ; ▪ fraud – inaccurate information within databases , logs , files or paper records ; ▪ abnormal system behavior ( e.g. , unscheduled system reboot , unexpected messages , abnormal errors in system log files or on terminals ) ; ▪ security event notifications ( e.g. , file integrity alerts , intrusion detection alarms , physical security alarms such as fire alarms , environmental alarms , natural disaster alerts ) . 300%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf in case of any alert it is imperati ve that all appropriate investigative or corrective action be taken by the manager receiving the alert notification to assure the integrity of the investigation and recovery process . 300%

Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.2 policy objective the goal of this document is to define the principles and guid elines for adoption in accor to make sure that information is protected in a way that is : • flexible - effective policy needs to be able to meet the current needs of the organization as well as future needs by accommodating changes in technology and the org anization ’ s threat model . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf information technology general it security policy it security last update : 11 june 2020 8/15 document version : 1.5 • feasible - goals should be measurable and attainable . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.3 scope the information technology ( it ) security policies apply to all information obtained , created , or maintained by accor ’ s information resources and systems . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf the s ecurity policy mus t : • identify information security objectives and risks for all major system s and application s. security measures must be comp liant with the identified risks . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • establish a thorough control system for information security , protect ing information resources from unauthorized access , leakage , falsification , loss , destruction , or interruption of operation . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • establish administrative control for information security in a management framework that ensures the confidentiality , integrity and availability of information . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf information technology general it security policy it security last update : 11 june 2020 10/15 document version : 1.5 • implement and maintain internal controls through monitoring and internal audits . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.8.3 responsibilities of associated teams general management the general management of the accor group is primari ly responsible for its informational assets , and must , therefore : • administrate the information security in accordance with the security policy and according to local laws and regulations ; • assume the costs linked to security and its management . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf countries / brand managers the countries /brand managers have to guarantee the application and the control of information security within their domain of responsibility . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf risk management team the risk management team must include it security risks i n a formal risk assessment process . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf personnel is also equally res ponsible for reporting any suspected or confirmed violations of this policy to the appropriate management . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.5 antiviruses all systems commonly affected by malicious software ( in particular , at the time of writing , microsoft windows and linux systems ) must be a ctively protected by antivirus software . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf moreover , a formal process must be in place to ensure that system and software components are protected from known vulnerabilities by having security patches installed . 300%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.7 application security to help prevent the creation of coding vulnerabilities , t he accor it security policy must be strictly enforced on all custom applications in the pci dss scope . 300%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf should always be notified to the data protection authority ; in case of an incident of low severity according to the same table , the incident response team will perform an in concreto analysis and decide whether the incident is likely to result in a risk for natural persons or not ; 3 source : guidelines on personal data breach notification under regulation 2016/679 ( wp250rev.01 ) accor cyber -attack and data breach response plan version : 1.8 date of effect : 09/06/202 1 page : 13 of 29 confidential – internal use only • where the notification to the data protection authority is not made within 72 hours , it shall be accompanied by reasons for the delay . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • elements included in the notifi cation should : - describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible , the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned , and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned - communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained - describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach - describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach , including , where appropriate , measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf where it processes personal data on behalf of a data controller ) , then accor sa must notify the controller of the incident without undue delay after becoming aware of a personal data breach . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf unless specific circumstances , an incident of high severity according to the table in section 3.3.1 abo ve should always be notified to the affected data subjects ; in case of an incident of low or medium severity according to the same table , the incident response team will perform an in concreto analysis and decide whether the incident is likely to result in a high risk for natural persons or not ; the notification should , in clear and plain language : • communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained ; • describe the likely cons equences of the personal data breach ; • describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach , including , where appropriate , measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf in all cases the notification should make reference to the measures described in appendix 6 that data subjects can take to mitigate possible adverse effects depending on the kind of information involved in the incident . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf communication to the impacted data subjects is not required if any of the following conditions are met : • the controller has imp lemented appropriate technical and organizational protection measures , and those measures were applied to the personal data affected by the personal data breach , in particular those that render the personal data unintelligible to any person who is not auth orized to access it , such as encryption ; accor cyber -attack and data breach response plan version : 1.8 date of effect : 09/06/202 1 page : 14 of 29 confidential – internal use only • the controller has taken subsequent measures which ensure that the high risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects is no longer likely to materialize . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf disconnect it from a network , and disable certain functions ) . 200%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • what to do to reduce the likelihood of it happening again ? 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident # 1 : theft of company unc lassified proprietary data ( medium ) • containment strategy o conduct an it check to monitor and contain the breach : ▪ if possible , record details about the intruder identity ( when speaking about an it incident , details can be : user id , ip address , computer name ) ▪ use approved controls to temporarily or permanently block the intruder ’ s access • evidence gathering and handling o collect evidences ( logs and traces ) to accurately identify all events on systems . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident # 2 : theft of company personal cus tomer ’ s data ( high ) • containment strategy o contain the intrusion and decide what action to take ; consider unplugging the network cables , applying highly restrictive acls ( access control list ) , deactivating or isolating the switch port , deactivating the user id , terminating the user ’ s session/change password etc . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf examples of useful questions : • how well did staff and management perform in dealing with the incident ? 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf description of the response lessons learned < < incident description > > < < date & time > > < < name of the team or person that is expected to handle the incident > > < < description of the expected actions , according to this cyber - attack/data breach response plan > > < < who did actually handled the incident during the test > > < < short description of actions performed > > < < was the response appropriate or did the test highlighted something to fix > > examples stolen payment terminal in hotel hxxxx 15th may 2018 hotel employee alert hotel gm front desk employee mentioned the incident during hotel team meeting ok hotel gm contact country security manager hotel gm explained the issue to the security manager by email ok security manager qualify incident , contain , monitor & warn security manager informed the hotel gm that it was an exercise . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf suspected server removed from the production pool and request sent to security team to cut the network flows at firewall level ok it security team collect and protect forensic evidence . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf gdpr requirements article 4 definitions for the purposes of this regulation : ( … ) ( 12 ) ‘ personal data breach ’ means a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction , loss , alteration , unauthorised disclosure of , or access to , personal data transmitted , stored or otherwise processed ; ( … ) article 33 notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority 1.in the case of a personal data breach , the controller shall without undue delay and , where feasible , not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it , notify the personal data breach to the supervisory authority competent in accordance with article 55 , unless the personal data breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf 3.the notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least : ( a ) describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible , the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned ; ( b ) communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact po int where more information can be obtained ; ( c ) describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach ; ( d ) describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach , including , where appropriate , mea sures to mitigate its possible adverse effects . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf 4.where , and in so far as , it is not possible to provide the information at the same time , the information may be provided in phases without undue further delay . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf accor cyber -attack and data breach response plan version : 1.8 date of effect : 09/06/202 1 page : 28 of 29 confidential – internal use only 2.the communication to the data subject re ferred to in paragraph 1 of this article shall describe in clear and plain language the nature of the personal data breach and contain at least the information and measures referred to in points ( b ) , ( c ) and ( d ) of article 33 ( 3 ) . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf 3.the communication to th e data subject referred to in paragraph 1 shall not be required if any of the following conditions are met : ( a ) the controller has implemented appropriate technical and organisational protection measures , and those measures were applied to the personal da ta affected by the personal data breach , in particular those that render the personal data unintelligible to any person who is not authorised to access it , such as encryption ; ( b ) the controller has taken subsequent measures which ensure that the high ris k to the rights and freedoms of data subjects referred to in paragraph 1 is no longer likely to materialise ; ( c ) it would involve disproportionate effort . 200%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf 4.if the controller has not already communicated the personal data breach to the data subject , the supervisory authority , having considered the likelihood of the personal data breach resulting in a high risk , may require it to do so or may decide that any of the conditions referred to in paragraph 3 are met . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf contents this document contains the set of policies for domains , areas , and aspects of accor ’ s it security . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf sources these policies are based on field experience and industry best practices , as well as on the set of information security policy templates from the sans institute : http : //www.sans.org/security -resources/policies/ related documentation the set of security policies and procedures documents are currently available from the accor intranet at the links : http : //acsa.accor.net/dgsit/pci/documents/livrables https : //pci.accor.net using this guide this document presents guidance and principles rather than specific procedures . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf it is designed to be read and implemented in a context that is co - defined in the complete set of security documentation . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf accor is also committed to protect ing the personal information of its guests , collected and processed in accor systems . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf the human , technical , industrial and financial consequences of dysfunctions or malicious activities must be known , monitored , and managed , while still ensuring the desired level of transparency . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf it is impossible in a document of this length to do more than summarize and highlight the risks a nd threats to accor group . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • malicious activities , such as : • abuse of privilege , confidential information disclosure • physical attack ( on systems , buildings , etc . ) 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • relevant - the policy must reflect the business goals of the organization . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf these policies apply equal ly to all levels of management and to the personnel they supervise . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf further , these policies apply to all information generated by accor ’ s information resources functions , from the time of creation through the time of transfer to ownership external to accor or its proper disposal/destruction . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.4 applicability these policies apply equally to all personnel , including , but not limited to , accor ’ s employees , agents , consultants , contractors , volunteers , vendors , business partners , and all other authorized users gra nted access to information resources . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.5 availability the most current version of this p olicy is available to all accor -internal stakeholders from the corporate intranet ( it / security section ) . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.6.2 granting exceptions the data owner and the digital services security team must approve and document all exceptions , based on an assessment of business requirements weighed agains t the likelihood of an unauthorized exposure and the potential adverse consequences for individuals , other organizations , or the accor group if exposure occurs as a result of the exception . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf as a condition for granting an exception , the chief information security officer ( ciso ) for a specific department may require the implementation of compensating controls to offset the risk created by the exception . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • advance the understanding of and generalize the responsibility for information security , through information sec urity education and training . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • make the b est use of existing solutions ( organization , procedures , hardware and software ) whenever possible . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • consider security as a process , not a one -time action , in particular through regular reviews in response to rapid changes in the environmen t. • define the information access rights in accordance with the “ least privilege principle ” and “ need to know ” basis . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • enforce control over third parties , negotiating contracts with outside parties that satisfy reliability requirements for such operations , and periodically monitor ing and report ing on the activities and work of outside parties to prevent the leakage of information . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf general employees all accor -internal stakeholders are responsible for managing their use of it and are accountable for their actions relating to it security . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf no activity may be conducted , nor any technology employed that might obstruct complia nce with any portion of the pci dss . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf pci dss applies to all business processes related to cardholder data and to all it systems involved in processing , storing or transmitting cardholder data . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf firewall rules must be reviewed at least every six months ; • network segmentation between untrusted networks , dmz and internal n etwork s by stateful firewalls ; • limitation of inbound and outbound traffic to that which is strictly necessary , prohibiting direct connection s between public networks and the cardholder data en vironment . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.2 configuration standards and patch management configuration standards must be maintained for applications , network componen ts , critical servers , and wireless access points in the pci dss scope . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.3 handling of cardholder data a formal data retention policy must be written to identify what data needs to be retained , for how long and where that data resides so it can be securely destroyed or deleted as soon as it is no longer needed . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf any manipulation of such data within accor must be validated by the accor pci dss management committee . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.4 access to cardholder data procedures for data control must be maintained by each department and must incorporate the following : • access rights to privileged user ids are restricted to the least privileges necessary to perform job responsibilities ; • assignment of privileges is based on job classification for individual personnel , and should only be granted after management approval ; • use of generic and shared accounts is forbidden ; • a strict password policy ( as detailed in pci dss requirement 8 ) must be enforced . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.6 change & patch management in the pci dss scope , a strict change management process must be in place , including change documentation and a formal approval process . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf a list of service providers must be maintained , and an annual process applied to monitor their pci dss compliance status . 200%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.12 security controls review at least quarterly , security controls implemented must be a review to verify that the security policy and operational procedures are followed in accordance with each dedicated process : • daily log reviews ; • firewall rule -set reviews ; • applying configuration st andards to new systems ; • responding to security alerts ; • change management processes . 200%

ITSOP_Plan_de_Reprise_Anti-Sinistre_Informatique_V01-01.docx ces documents permettront à l ’ équipe d ’ intervention d ’ urgence et aux équipes de récupération de se remettre du désastre le plus rapidement possible . 200%

ITSOP_Plan_de_Reprise_Anti-Sinistre_Informatique_V01-01.docx il est essentiel de mettre en place une stratégie de sauvegarde complète et sûre qui vous permette de vous remettre de n'importe quel désastre pour n'importe quel système . 200%

ITSOP_Plan_de_Reprise_Anti-Sinistre_Informatique_V01-01.docx une maintenance adéquate des équipements et des supports de sauvegarde doit être assurée , y compris le cycle de vie des supports de sauvegarde , l'utilisation de supports de nettoyage , etc… le logiciel de sauvegarde utilisé doit être supporté par un contrat d'assistance en vigueur . 200%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf context although accor is taking the necessary steps to ensure protection of personal data ( including cardholder data ) , the risk of a cyber -attack or a data breach still exists . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf under m any regulations around the world it is mandatory to notify data breaches to data protection authorities , mainly when it implies personal data . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf for example : ▪ the gdpr requires such notification to be sent to the competent authority ( no later than 72 hours after beco ming aware of a breach ) and to the natural persons , where the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to such natural persons ; ▪ pci dss requires notifications to be sent to the schemes according to specific deadlines defined for each scheme . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf accor is committed to comply with th ese regulation s and standards whether it concerns its clients , prospects , employees , or partners ’ data . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf if the criteria defined to qualify an event as a country/region or a world wide crisis are met , this cyber -attack/data breach response plan may be accompanied by the group 's crisis management manual ( `` alert `` ) 1 . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf goals the present document aims at defining the proce dures that the various stakeholders within the organization must follow in case of a cyber -attack or a data b reach . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf it provides the appropriate tools to identify and report alerts , qualify alerts as incidents and provide appropriate response ( responsibili ties , identification , incident plan , test and response steps ) . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf data protection officer or dpo the position created by the gdpr and which primary role is to ensure that the organization processes the personal data of its staff , customers , providers or any other natural person in compliance with the applicable data protection rules and which acts as a point of contact with the data protection authorities . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf gdpr the regulation ( eu ) 2016/679 of the european parliament and of the council of 27 april 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident a personal data breach , meaning a breach of security leading to either : - the accidental or unlawful destruction of… - the accidental or unlawful loss of… - the accidental or unlawful alteration of… - unauthorized disclosure of… - unauthorized access to… personal data transmitted , stored or otherwise processed . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf examples : - personal data ( such as usernames , passwords or purchases history ) are published online by an attacker ; - personal data have been stolen or lost on a physical media ( paper , it device , backup material , etc . ) 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf ; - an email is sent to s everal recipients in “ to : ” or “ cc : ” field , thereby all recipient can see the email address of other recipient . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident report sheet or irs the document presented in appendix 3 centralizing all information on an incident and serving as a basis for communication between stakeholders . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident response team the team as described in appendix 4 in charge of handling incidents and coordinating all actions in order to bring appropria te response to an incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf pci dss the current version in force of the payment card industry data security standard ( v3.2.1 as of june 2018 ) . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf this position work s closely to support other departments to manage pci , to coordinate the annual assessment process and also with the worldwide community to follow local headquarters and hotels compliance . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf it leader implement s log requirements and specific response mechanisms ( password reset , etc . ) 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf provide s assistance to it security team ( diagnostic , data gathering , containment , etc . ) 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf communicate s and inform it security team . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf collect s information on all alerts and incidents . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf prepares written summary of the incident and correctives actions taken . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf gather s evidenc e of the data breach . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf provide s assistance for the exercise or defense of legal claims . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf communication team monitor s relations with press / media ( q & a , talking point , p ress communication , financial communication , internal communication ) . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf assist s in the elaboration of communication to the relevant audience ( ex . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf take s decisions on the course of actions based on the incident . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf preparation the incident response process has several phases . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf during preparation , we also try to limit the number of incidents that will occur by selecting and implementing a set of controls based on the results of risk assessments . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf detection of security breaches is thus necessary to alert stakeholders whenever incidents occur . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf preparing to handle incidents the lists below provide examples of tools and resources available that may be of value during incident handling . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf when an event is detected , the it security team must be able to use logs to track and identify the root cause . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf training the incident response team all employees in contact with personal data must be trained appropriately and on a yearly basis to ensure proper handling of data and reduce the likelihood of accidental deletion , modification or transmission of data . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf individuals must take re asonable precautions to protect personal data from deletion , modification , loss , or any kind of unauthorized action . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf attack vectors incidents can occur in countless ways , so it is infeasible to develop step -by-step instructions for handling every incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf different types of incidents merit different response strategies . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf the attack vectors listed below are not intended to provide definitive classification for incidents ; rather , they simply list common methods of attack , which can be used as a basi s for defining more specific procedures . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • external/removable media : an attack executed from removable media or a peripheral device —for example , malicious code spreading onto a system from an infected usb flash drive . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • web : an attack executed from a website or web -based application . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • email : an attack executed via an email message or attachment —for example , exploit code disguised as an attached document or a link to a malicious website in the body of an email message . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • data exfiltration : an attack executed with the objective to steal or take ownership over business or proprietary data – for example , clients ’ data or preferences . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • third-party services : an attack involving a third -party that provides services to the entity – for example , compromised software or tooling . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf accor cyber -attack and data breach response plan version : 1.8 date of effect : 09/06/202 1 page : 8 of 29 confidential – internal use only other : an attack that does not fit into any of the other categories . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf this section focuses on recommended practices for handling any type of incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf employees must be aware of their responsibilities in detecting security alerts to facilitate the incident response plan and procedures . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf all employees have the responsibility to assist in the incident response procedures within thei r areas of responsibility . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf if the alert was qualified as actual incident , all communications with law enforcement or the public will be coordinated by the incident response team ; • document any information while waiting for the incident response team to resp ond to the incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf this must include date , time , and the nature of the incident , if known . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf any information the manager can provide will help in responding in an appropriate manner ➔ use the report on initial observations template in appendix 2 ; • remain available for any solicitation by the incident response team . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident qualification incident response team should first confirm the qualification of the alert as an incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf if the qualification as an incident is confirmed by the incident response team , the latter measures the severity of the incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incidents should not be handled on a first -come , first -served basis as a result of resource limitations . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf for example , a malicious agent may exfiltrate sensitive information . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf incident handlers should consider how this information exfiltration will impact t he organization ’ s overall mission . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf category definition low “ integrity loss ” unclassified information was changed or deleted on corporate non -critical systems or resources . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf “ proprietary breach ” unclassified proprietary information were accessed . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf examples : • disclosure of non -sensitive guests preferences for a limited number of individuals . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf medium “ proprietary unclassified proprietary information were exfiltrated . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf “ integrity loss ” sensitive or proprietary information was changed or deleted on cor porate non -critical systems or resources . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf high “ privacy breach ” sensitive personall y identifiable information ( pii – gdpr ) , credit card data ( pci dss ) , employees , beneficiaries , etc . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf examples : • actual breach of security ( e.g . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf “ proprietary breach ” classified proprietary information , such as protected critical infrastructure information ( pcii ) , was accessed or exfiltrated . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf “ integrity loss ” sensitive or proprietary information was changed or deleted on corporate critical systems or resources . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf important : in case of an incident impacting several factors , the maximum category level “ low , medium or high ” must be considered between all o f these . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf for the operational treatment , the « it security irp » outlines the « incident prioritization » along with target recovery time in each case : https : //co nfluence.accor.net/display/securitypub/incident+response+management 2.2.5 . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf preserve all potential electronic evidence on a plat form suitable for review and analysis by a court of law if needed 5 . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf perform remote vulnerability scan of entity ’ s internet facing site ( s ) 2.2.5.3 special notification : gdpr according to the gdpr , the scheme3 in appendix 8 must be followed to assess the necessity to notify an incident to a data protection authority and , if the case may be , to the affected data subjects . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf notification to data protection authorities : if the incident involves a data processing activity under the control of accor sa , the fre nch data protection authority ( the “ cnil ” ) must be notified of the breach . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf in accordance with gdpr , the notification to a european data protection authority shoul d be performed as follows : • where feasible , the personal data breach must be notified to the data protection authority within 72 hours after having become aware of the data breach , unless the personal data breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons ; unless specific circumstances , an incident of medium or high severity according to the table in section error ! 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf please refer to appendix 5 for a step -by-step description of how to notify the data breach to the cnil . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf in case of an incident involving a trans -border data processing activity targeting data subjects in several european or non-european countries , the incident response team analyses potential other notification duties according to the applicable regulations . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf this notific ation should include all information as listed above in order for the data controller to comply with its own notification duties . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf notification to the affected data subjects : in accordance with gdpr the data controller is required to notify the affected d ata subjects in the case of an incident , when the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf this notification is prepared with the support of the communication team . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • it would involve disproportionate effort . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf the relevant data protection authority may decide to classify the incident as high risk and require communication to be made , or that communication is not necessary if one of the conditions above is met . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf most incide nts require containment , so that is an important consideration early in the course of handling each incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf an essential part of containment is decision -making ( e.g . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf network connectivity , services provided to external parties ) • time and resources needed to implement the strategy . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • effectiveness of the strategy ( e.g . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf partial containment , full containment ) • duration of the solution ( e.g . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf evidence gathering and handling although the primary reason for gathering evidence during an incident is to resolve the incident , it may also be needed for legal or investigation cases . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf in such cases , it is important to clearly document how all evidence , including compromised systems , has been preser ved . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf in addition , evidence should be accounted for at all times ; whenever evidence is transferred from person to person , chain of custody forms should detail the transfer . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf identifying the origin during incident handling , system owners and others sometimes want to or need to identify the attacking host or hosts . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf although this information can be important , incident handlers should generally stay focused on containment , eradication , and recovery . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf creating a root cause analysis map this connects individual cause and effect relationships to reveal the root cause of the incident . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf at a high level , the cause map he lps to create a visual representation of the event by determining the following : • what happened ? 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • why it happened ? 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf of course , each of these steps requires careful and objective analysis . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf this must be performed by those with both subject matter expertise ( sme ) and background knowledge of the circumstances leading up to the incident accor cyber -attack and data breach response plan version : 1.8 date of effect : 09/06/202 1 page : 15 of 29 confidential – internal use only 2.3.4 . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf eradication and recovery after an inci dent has been contained , eradication may be necessary to eliminate components of the incident , such as deleting malware and disabling breached user accounts , as well as identifying and mitigating all vulnerabilities that were exploited . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf during eradication , it is important to identify all affected assets within the organization so that they can be remediated . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf for large -scale incidents , recovery may take months ; the intent of the early phases should be to increase the overall security with relatively quick ( days to weeks ) high value changes to prevent future incidents . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf lessons learned one of the most important parts of incident response is also the most often omitted : learning and improving . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf holding a “ lessons learned ” meeting with all involved parties after a major incident , and optionally periodically , can be extremely helpful in improving security measures and the incident handling process itself . 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • what information was needed sooner ? 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • what would the staff and management do differently th e next time a similar incident occurs ? 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf • how could information sharing with other or ganizations have been improved ? 100%
Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf annual testing and review the following cyber -attack/data breach response plan should be tested and reviewed annually to ensure that everyone is aware of the actions and contact points in case of an incident . 100%

Accor_Cyber-attack_Data_Breach_Response_Plan_v_1.8.pdf article 34 communication of a personal data breach to the data subject 1.when the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons , the controller shall communicate the personal data breach to the data subject without undue delay . 100%

Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf audience this document is written for the complete set of stakeholders in the accor community , including employees , contractors , interns , and suppliers . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf what ’ s not in this document this docum ent is not by itself an exhaustive guide to or defin ition of accor security policy . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf no part of this document may be reproduced , distributed , or transmitted in any form or by any means , including photocopying , recording , or other electronic or mechanical methods , without the prior written permission from accor . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.1.1 analyses the inform ation security policy must be defined around multiple analyses , including in particular : • current and future information systems ; • vulnerabilities that could impact missions and operations that are critical for accor group ; • expected threats ; • existing securit y measures . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.1.2 threats and risks information security can only be applied in an environment where risks have been identified , even if only in the broadest terms . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • errors , such as : • infrastructure design or administration errors • software design or implementation errors ( bugs ) . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • logical attack ( on infrastructure , software , etc . ) . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • applicable - the policy must reflect the realities of the environment . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf effort and materials expended should be in proportion to the value of the asset s they are meant to safeguard . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf while the policy is not intended to dictate the method of implementation , defining policy that is not possible to implement creates confusion and waste d effort . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf the accor it security policy must be applied immediately after its official publication by all entities , brands and activities that belong to the group . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf adherence to these policies , practice standards , procedures , and g uidelines issued in support of these policy statements is mandatory . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.6 exceptions the accor it security team must approve in advance any exceptions to any approved policy . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf an exception may be granted to address the specific circumstances or business needs relating to an individual program or dep artment . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf requests for exceptions of this type should be in writing ( email is acceptable ) and should be initiated by the data owner . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf requests for exceptions of this typ e may come from any person , or such exceptions may be initiated by the ciso . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.7 security principles accor must manage i nformational risks in the same terms as any other risks , whether legal , financial , operational , social , penal and so on . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf this section outlines the essential principles that underlie the set of accor security policies and procedures . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf as part of that framework , accor -internal stakeholders must be brought to understand that they are responsible for their decisions and actions . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • avoid impact s on the availability of the operational infrastructures . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • include security in the lifecycle of projects and services . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.8 responsibility 1.8.1 responsibility for security polic ies overall responsibility for creating , communicating , distributing , maintaining , and enforcing security policies lies jointly with : • human resources department • chief information security officer ( ciso ) 1.8.2 responsibility for information security within accor , responsibility for matters relating to information security lies with the chief information security officer . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • coordination of compliance -related activities ( such as pci dss ) . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf it teams all it teams must maintain daily administrative and tec hnical operational security procedures that are consistent with the accor it security policy . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf internal it audit team the internal it audit team must regular ly check compliance with the accor it security policy . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf all security violations must be reported to the custodian or owner department management . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf the security awareness of personnel must be continually emphasized , reinforced , updated and validated . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf third parties partners , and services and product providers must conform to the accor it security policy . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf processes and system documentation must specify how each requirement is implemented . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1 document in progress at the time of writing . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf system components and applications must be protected from known vulnerabilities by having the latest vendor -supplied security patches installed . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf cardholder data storage must never exceed the business need . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf this retention policy must cover all storage of cardholder data , including electronic storage ( databases , servers , files , etc . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf storage of sensitive card authentica tion data ( magnetic stripe data , card validati on code or value , and pin ) after authorization is prohibited . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf the handling of p ayment card primary account n umbers ( pan s ) requires attention : • pan s must be rendered unreadable anywhere they are stored . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf this antivirus software must generate audit logs . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.10.11 partners and third parties partners and third parties involved in cardholder data manipulation on behalf of accor are a source of risk . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf before contracting with such providers , the following process must be fol lowed : • due diligence must be carried out , to vali date the provider ’ s security level , at l east through a penetration test . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf • a written agreement must include the acknowledgement that the service provider is responsible for the security of cardholder data . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.11 penalties violation of any of the requirements in this policy by any accor -internal stakeholder will result in suitable disciplinary action , up to and including prosecution and/or termination . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf violation of any of the requirements in this policy by any visitor can result in similar disciplinary action against the sponsoring employee and can also result in termination of services with any associated consulting organization or prosecution in the case of criminal activity . 100%
Accor_General_IT_Security_Policy.pdf 1.12 policy reviews this policy shall be reviewed at least annually and updated as needed to reflect changes to business objectives or the risk environment . 100%

IT_Technical_Competency_Framework_2021v01.pdf this aims at helping line managers and employees to familiarize themsel ves with the concept of technical competencies and their applications as well as to buil d a culture with high productivity . 100%

IT_Technical_Competency_Framework_2021v01.pdf the technical competency framework is a set of anticipated knowledge , skills , and/or abilities that lead to an acceptable performance level at work . 100%

IT_Technical_Competency_Framework_2021v01.pdf this defines in details what the competency is about and what it encompasses . 100%

IT_Technical_Competency_Framework_2021v01.pdf the level of progression and complexity of the competency gradually increases as the employee moves from one level to another . 100%

IT_Technical_Competency_Framework_2021v01.pdf learning and development during the skills assessment phase , it supports the identification o f knowledge , skills , and / or abilities that require development . 100%

Physical_Security_Policy.docx physical security policy internal use only version status this version of this document is currently : document history projected review date : ( = 12 months after publication ) this document table of contents introduction context to be effective , organizational and logical security measures in place to protect payment card data must be completed by physical security . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx policy objective the goal of this document is to describe the organization , guidelines , and procedures that accor puts in place to manage the physical security of its confidential data . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx entry to those pci dss scope areas is only possible on the presentation of an authorized badge . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx video cameras accesses to the racks are monitored by videos cameras positioned as follows : cameras must support : infrared visibility up to 20 meters minimum resolution of 720p cameras must be positioned in a way that prevents unauthorized tampering or disabling . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx by french law , data from the video cameras is stored for a maximum of one month . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx network access in accor central datacenters , all network jacks related to the pci dss environment must be enclosed in a pci dss rack to prevent unauthorized access . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx a quarterly review is performed by accor security team to detect the presence of unauthorized access points . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx access to pci racks : if access to a pci rack is necessary , an additional check-in / check-out procedure is performed just before the server room entry . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx on termination of the visit , the visitor completes and signs the check-out entry in the visitor log before getting back his id . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx visitor logs that contain the record of all visits must be retained for a minimum of three months . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx a log ( “ registre de sécurité ” ) must be filled for any use of these generic badges . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx badge management ( evry ) after being hired , accor employees in evry receive a nominative badge . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx datacenter review every quarter , a data center security review must be performed to control the presence of rogue wifi access points , media storage security and to check the list of people authorized to access the data center . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx protect the pc at the front desk the pci-dss norm requires controlled access to all systems that store , transmit or process payment card data . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx the basic recommendation here is : to store the central unit of your front-desk pc in a closed cupboard . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx ventilation : the closed cupboard where you will enclose the computer and peripherals has enough holes in it to ventilate the devices correctly . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx protect access to the accor network physical access to the hotel network should be protected against illegitimate access . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx protect the back-office the hotel must have an access-controlled area where you can store and archive sensitive documents that contain payment card information . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx shred sensitive paper crosscut shredders should be available to hotel employees who handle paper with payment card information , including post-it notes , faxes , and bills . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx install video cameras anywhere that payment card information is handled or stored ; a video camera should be in place for monitoring entry/exit points to these sensitive areas . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx for more information , check with legal services in your country . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx such media must be classified as “ pci ” by a sticker an inventory must be maintained and reviewed annually media must be stored securely management approval is required before any media distribution central systems procedures primary datacenter ( elancourt ) media inventory and classification is maintained by thales teams . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx datacenters are quarterly assessed based on the datacenter security review process ( cf . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx media destruction at the time of expiry , cardholder data on electronic media must be made unrecoverable so that cardholder data can not be reconstructed . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx a certificate of destruction must be provided to close the case . 100%
Physical_Security_Policy.docx tapes : chd-tapes are stored securely up to the time of the destruction of the data that they contain . 100%

Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf contents this document contains the general rules , responsibilities and process in place in accor regarding the risk ranking policy . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf audience this document is addressed to all stakeholders in the accor it community , including employees , contractors , interns , and suppliers . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf related documentation the set of security policies and procedures documents are currently available from the accor intranet . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf using this guide this document presents guidance and principles behind and in procedures , along with general information about procedures . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf it does not , however , provide an exhaustive user ’ s manual for specific procedures . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf 1.2 scope all components included in the pci dss scope must adhere to the rules and process defined in this document . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf 1.3 policy assum ptions this risk ranking policy supplements the general it security policy without replacing it or contradicting it . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf in particular , the present policy shares the following elements from the general it security policy document : • security principles • availability • applicability • exceptions • responsibility • penalties • policy reviews • related documents these elements are not repeated in this document . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf the intent of this requirement is that organizations keep up to date with new vulnerabilities that may impact their environment . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf sources for vulnerability information should be trustworthy and oft en include vendor websites , industry newsgroups , mailing list , or rss feeds . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf note : risk rankings should be based on industry best practices as well as consideration of potential impact . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf for example , criteria for ranking vulnerabilities may include consideration of the cvss base score , and/or the classification by the vendor , a nd/or type of systems affected . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf this severity ranking may also be used for any other it resources . 100%
Risk_Ranking_Policy.pdf security threat level • for components directly reachable from the internet ( 1 ) : o vendor patches and security updates defined as “ high ” , “ critical ” or “ urgent ” by vendors ( except vulnerability that only leads to denial of service ) or : o cvss base score ≥ 4 ( except vulnerability that only leads to denial of service ) • all vendor patches that will be evaluated as “ critical ” by the accor security team high • for components directly reachable from the internet ( 1 ) : o vendor patches and security updates not defined as “ high ” , “ critical ” or “ urgent ” by vendors or : o cvss base score < 4 or : o vulnerabilities that only lead to denial of service • for all components with an internal exposure only • all vendor patches and security updates for other components low a justified risk -based analysis or temporary palliative remediation can be supplied by accor to reduce risk level from high to low . 100%

ITSOP_POS_Plan_durgence_V01-00.docx imprime les chèques hors ligne , en remplissant les paiements en espèces et par carte de crédit . 100%

ITSOP_POS_Plan_durgence_V01-00.docx est responsable de la direction de l'équipe de cuisine pendant le plan d ’ urgence , sans problèmes opérationnels . 100%

ITSOP_POS_Plan_durgence_V01-00.docx classe par ordre de priorité les clients en départ aujourd'hui pour le posting manuel et/ou un recouvrement de paiement . 100%
